CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: As the annealing temperature increased from 25 to 140 °C , weak diffraction peaks at 25.4 ° , 27.8 ° , and 29.3 ° emerged , and the diffraction peaks at 21.4 ° and 23.8 ° were slightly increased. Similarly , for PzNDTDTBO , after annealing at 220 °C , weak diffraction peaks at 4.3 ° and 8.5 ° appeared , and the peak at 32.9 ° , corresponding to a π-π stacking distance of 2.7 Å , became stronger and sharper. These XRD studies clearly manifest the enhancement of molecular ordering within thin films of PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO after annealing , which are in agreement with the observation that hole mobilities of devices increase with annealing. In addition , the high crystallinity of the PzNDTDTBO film can also explain the high hole mobility of the PzNDTDTBO / PC71BM blend film measured by SCLC method mentioned above. AFM images were performed on polymer thin films on OTSmodified SiO 2 / Si substrates as shown in Figure 12. The highly uniform intertwined polymer fibers are observed for both of the two polymers. With film annealing treatments , the films form larger crystal grains and better film interconnectivity , which are favorable for the charge transport and lead to an increase of the mobility . In conclusion , two new D-A copolymers with zNDT as donor unit and BT or BO as acceptor unit , namely PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO , have been synthesized by the Pd - catalyzed Stille - coupling reaction and well characterized. Both the copolymers possess good solubility and thermal stability as well as low bandgap for efficient photon harvesting. Compared with its BT - based analogue PzNDTDTBT , the introduction of the stronger electron - accepting BO unit into PzNDTDTBO not only enhanced the intramolecular charge transfer in the conjugated polymer but also downshifted the HOMO energy level of the organic semiconductor , and as a result , BHJ solar cells incorporating blends of the PzNDTDTBO with PC71BM showed the PCE of 5.07% after device optimization such as adding additive and thermal annealing , while a PCE of 3.22% was obtained in PzNDTDTBT - based devices. OFETs devices based on PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO exhibit high carrier mobilities of 0.43 and 0.34 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , respectively. Both the hole mobilities and PCEs are among the highest values in the current reported devices fabricated from naphthodithiophenebased copolymers. These results demonstrate that the 4,9bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)naphtho [1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene is a promising versatile core unit for developing high - performance OFETs and polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PzNDTDTBT - This is mentioned in the paragraph as the name of the first copolymer.
2. PzNDTDTBO - This is mentioned in the paragraph as the name of the second copolymer.
3. PC71BM - This is mentioned in the paragraph as a blend material used in the devices.
4. SiO2/Si - This is mentioned in the paragraph as the substrate material used for the AFM images.
5. BT - This is mentioned in the paragraph as the acceptor unit in the copolymers.
6. BO - This is mentioned in the paragraph as the acceptor unit in the copolymers.
7. HOMO - This is mentioned in the paragraph as the highest occupied molecular orbital energy level.
8. LUMO - This is mentioned in the paragraph as the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital energy level.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the given text:

1. PzNDTDTBT
2. PzNDTDTBO

These are the two copolymers that are being referred to in the text as "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities related to "Material Name" in the original paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PzNDTDTBT |
| PzNDTDTBO |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: As the annealing temperature increased from 25 to 140 °C , weak diffraction peaks at 25.4 ° , 27.8 ° , and 29.3 ° emerged , and the diffraction peaks at 21.4 ° and 23.8 ° were slightly increased. Similarly , for PzNDTDTBO , after annealing at 220 °C , weak diffraction peaks at 4.3 ° and 8.5 ° appeared , and the peak at 32.9 ° , corresponding to a π-π stacking distance of 2.7 Å , became stronger and sharper. These XRD studies clearly manifest the enhancement of molecular ordering within thin films of PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO after annealing , which are in agreement with the observation that hole mobilities of devices increase with annealing. In addition , the high crystallinity of the PzNDTDTBO film can also explain the high hole mobility of the PzNDTDTBO / PC71BM blend film measured by SCLC method mentioned above. AFM images were performed on polymer thin films on OTSmodified SiO 2 / Si substrates as shown in Figure 12. The highly uniform intertwined polymer fibers are observed for both of the two polymers. With film annealing treatments , the films form larger crystal grains and better film interconnectivity , which are favorable for the charge transport and lead to an increase of the mobility . In conclusion , two new D-A copolymers with zNDT as donor unit and BT or BO as acceptor unit , namely PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO , have been synthesized by the Pd - catalyzed Stille - coupling reaction and well characterized. Both the copolymers possess good solubility and thermal stability as well as low bandgap for efficient photon harvesting. Compared with its BT - based analogue PzNDTDTBT , the introduction of the stronger electron - accepting BO unit into PzNDTDTBO not only enhanced the intramolecular charge transfer in the conjugated polymer but also downshifted the HOMO energy level of the organic semiconductor , and as a result , BHJ solar cells incorporating blends of the PzNDTDTBO with PC71BM showed the PCE of 5.07% after device optimization such as adding additive and thermal annealing , while a PCE of 3.22% was obtained in PzNDTDTBT - based devices. OFETs devices based on PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO exhibit high carrier mobilities of 0.43 and 0.34 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , respectively. Both the hole mobilities and PCEs are among the highest values in the current reported devices fabricated from naphthodithiophenebased copolymers. These results demonstrate that the 4,9bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)naphtho [1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene is a promising versatile core unit for developing high - performance OFETs and polymer solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PzNDTDTBT - Poly(4,9-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)naphtho[1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene)
2. PzNDTDTBO - Poly(4,9-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)naphtho[1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene-co-benzothieno[3,2-b]thieno[3,2-d]thiophene)
3. PC71BM - Poly[7,7-di(thienyl)fluorene-co-phenylene vinylene]
4. SiO2 - Silicon dioxide
5. Si - Silicon
6. OTS - Optically thin silver (Ag) layer
7. HOMO - Highest occupied molecular orbital
8. LUMO - Lowest unoccupied molecular orbital
9. PCE - Power conversion efficiency
10. OFETs - Organic field-effect transistors

Note that some of these terms are mentioned multiple times in the paragraph, but I have only listed them once with their corresponding property names.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities that refer to the property names of materials in the paragraph:

1. PzNDTDTBT - Poly(4,9-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)naphtho[1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene) (material name)
2. PzNDTDTBO - Poly(4,9-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)naphtho[1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene-co-benzothieno[3,2-b]thieno[3,2-d]thiophene) (material name)
3. PC71BM - Poly[7,7-di(thienyl)fluorene-co-phenylene vinylene] (material name)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PzNDTDTBT |
| PzNDTDTBO |
| PC71BM |

Paragraph: As the annealing temperature increased from 25 to 140 °C , weak diffraction peaks at 25.4 ° , 27.8 ° , and 29.3 ° emerged , and the diffraction peaks at 21.4 ° and 23.8 ° were slightly increased. Similarly , for PzNDTDTBO , after annealing at 220 °C , weak diffraction peaks at 4.3 ° and 8.5 ° appeared , and the peak at 32.9 ° , corresponding to a π-π stacking distance of 2.7 Å , became stronger and sharper.
